item.title: Huawei assures users of phones and tablets that it will maintain support services
item.description: A Reuters report revealed that Google is planning to cease business operations with Huawei concerning software, hardware, and services that are not open source. This decision stems from a US government order against Huawei. The impact of this decision is projected to affect only new Huawei phones, leaving existing phones unaffected. Android confirmed via Twitter that Google Play and its associated security features will remain operational on current Huawei devices.

item.title: Switch to organic bath and shower products
item.description: According to research firm Technavio, consumers are increasingly interested in bath and shower products that offer both organic ingredients and convenience. The company’s report on the global bath and shower products market highlights that rising living standards and disposable income are driving consumers towards higher-priced, aesthetically pleasing products with unique fragrances and effective ingredients. This trend is projected to propel the market to a value of at least US$15 billion by 2019, reflecting a compound annual growth rate (CAGR) of approximately 4% from 2015 to 2019.

item.title: The exclusive offers available at the 26th edition of The PC Show
item.description: The PC Show, celebrating 26 years of IT and consumer electronics in Singapore, is back. Major brands like Best Denki, Canon, Courts, Creative, Dell, Epson, Harvey Norman, HP, Lenovo, M1, Newstead, Samsung, Seagate, Singtel, and Toshiba will offer exciting products, deals, and competitive prices. Gillian Loh, Project Manager at Lines Exposition and Management Services, highlighted that attendees often look for great deals and the latest technology at the show. Organizers aim to continually improve the visitor experience, and this year they are introducing dedicated zones for specific interests and providing online updates on deals and new products.

item.title: Accenture demonstrates a potential vision of the future of retail in the Asia Pacific region
item.description: A recent report from Accenture, “The future is now: understanding the new Asian consumer,” highlights that consumer packaged goods (CPG) companies need to embrace digital commerce fully or face being overtaken by newer players in the rapidly growing Asia Pacific market. This market is expected to grow by US$340 billion by 2020, with China leading the way. Accenture emphasizes that CPG companies must adapt to a new generation of consumers who prefer digital engagement and trust social influence.

item.description: Dell is promoting several products at the Consumer Electronics Exhibition (CEE) 2017. item.description: Dell and Alienware are offering promotions on select products at SITEX 2016, taking place from November 26th to 27th at the Singapore Expo Halls 5 and 6. XPS 13 Laptop Known as the world’s smallest 13" laptop, the latest XPS prioritizes performance, portability, and impressive visuals. Its stand-out feature is the InfinityEdge display, which is practically borderless. This model boasts a powerful 7th Gen Intel Core i7 processor for enhanced performance and prolonged battery life.

item.title: SITEX 2016 guarantees an immersive and educational experience
item.description: Source: SITEX website. Scene from SITEX 2015. SITEX, Singapore’s yearly consumer technology showcase, aims to bridge the gap between individuals and technology. This year, it promises an elevated experience with new interactive activities like a technology-infused dance competition, a dedicated space for children’s technology (IMDA Pixel Labs), displays of intelligent systems from NTU, and the SITEX Innovation Alley presented by the Singapore Infocomm Technology Federation (SITF). These additions are designed to educate, entertain, and captivate visitors.

item.title: Euromonitor categorizes audiences into seven different consumer types
item.description: Euromonitor’s Survey team has identified seven distinct global consumer types based on their Global Consumer Trends survey: the Undaunted Striver, Impulsive Spender, Balanced Optimist, Aspiring Struggler, Conservative Homebody, Independent Skeptic and Secure Traditionalist. Source: Euromonitor website. Each consumer type exhibits unique preferences and habits, even when sharing similar demographics. For instance, the relatively young Impulsive Spender views life as busy but exciting, characterized by a social, indulgent, and friend-oriented nature. Conversely, Independent Skeptics, also categorized as young consumers, define themselves by living life on their own terms, embracing unconventionality, skepticism, and indifference.

item.description: Source: MCI. HE the Minister of Commerce and Investment Dr Majid bin Abdullah Al Qasabi launched the Sales app on 31 January 2017. item.title: Smart mirror launched by FRED Technologies
item.description: FRED Technologies has introduced “Mirror,” a waterproof smart mirror designed as a modern-day butler. This Android-powered device displays news and interacts with various lifestyle apps and devices. Equipped with speakers in a sleek, champagne gold frame, Mirror plays music and responds to voice commands. Its smart display activates when approached and reverts to a standard mirror when not in use. The built-in air purifying technology keeps the surrounding environment fresh.

item.title: Get your hands on StarHub's flyers for CEE 2017 by downloading them now
item.description: Source: StarHub. StarHub, recognized as Singapore’s most environmentally friendly telecommunications company, will participate in the 2017 Consumer Electronics Exhibition (CEE). Details about StarHub’s mobile, television, broadband, and bundled services are available in online promotional flyers. These flyers, which include information about the Business Fibre Broadband Bundle, are specifically designed for business customers. The 2017 CEE will take place at Suntec from June 1st to June 4th. The event will be open from 11 am to 9 pm on levels 1 and 3, and from 12 pm to 9 pm in Halls 403 to 406 on level 4.

item.title: Dell has launched a new Dell Exclusive Store in Singapore
item.description: The store opening was celebrated with a ribbon cutting. Dell recently launched a new Exclusive Store in Singapore’s Plaza Singapura mall. This location was chosen for its accessibility and retail focus. The store displays Dell’s complete line of consumer products, as well as a dedicated virtual reality (VR) experience zone. The store is set up for customers to try before they buy. It has experience suites featuring Dell’s newest XPS, Inspiron, and Alienware products.

item.description: Source: CA Technologies infographic. People are pickier than ever about the apps they use, so businesses that don’t offer a good app experience could lose a significant portion of their customers. A regional study* sponsored by CA Technologies shows that mobile and desktop applications in the Asia Pacific & Japan (APJ) region have become key to earning customer loyalty. item.title: IDC reveals the preferences of APAC consumers when it comes to mobile devices
item.description: The International Data Corporation (IDC) has released an infographic that reveals how consumers in the Asia Pacific region make decisions about mobile devices. Key findings from the Essential Guide to Device Decisions of a Connected Consumer in Asia Pacific report include: Source: IDC infographic. What consumers like about bigger phone screens. 77% of surveyed consumers reported having a larger smartphone now than their previous device, while only 8% opted for a smaller one.

item.title: HubSpot uncovers the true desires of buyers when it comes to salespeople
item.description: HubSpot’s recent report, Asia Pacific Buyers Have Spoken: Sales Needs to Evolve, reveals what Asia Pacific buyers desire in a sales experience, from initial call topics to the best time for sales interactions. The report suggests that sales isn’t necessarily becoming more challenging, but rather traditional sales strategies are losing their effectiveness. The mismatch between current sales tactics and buyer expectations is the root of the problem. HubSpot asserts that conversions will increase if salespeople align their approach with buyer preferences.

item.title: According to GfK, Singaporean travelers frequently plan their trips with less than a month's notice
item.description: A Jetstar aircraft at Singapore’s Changi Airport. Companies can potentially reduce travel expenses by adopting strategies used by individual travelers. A study by GfK revealed that roughly 76% of trips originating in Singapore were booked no more than one month before the travel date. Laurens van den Oever, Global Travel Director at GfK, suggests that this trend of booking close to the travel date is likely due to airlines offering discounted fares for last-minute flights.

item.title: The Dubai consumer electronics market is projected to exceed a value of US$3 billion by the year 2020
item.description: A Dubai Chamber of Commerce and Industry (DCCI) analysis, presented at GITEX Technology Week 2016, projects that the Dubai consumer electronics market will expand by 4.7% over the next four years, surpassing US$3 billion by 2020. The analysis emphasizes Dubai’s robust retail sales growth despite challenges from low oil prices and global economic uncertainties. This strength is credited to strong underlying factors, including a growing population, increasing incomes, and a consistent influx of tourists.

item.title: CEE is ready to showcase gadgets and games
item.description: The 4th Consumer Electronics Exhibition (CEE) will be held from May 23rd to 26th, 2019, at Suntec Singapore Convention Centre. The event is organized by Exhibits Inc., a subsidiary of Sphere Exhibits, which is the events and exhibitions branch of Singapore Press Holdings. Some of the featured events include: Singapore Robo Fight 2019 (Level 4, Gamex Booth 8601) Attendees can use smartphones to control miniature battle robots and engage in virtual combat.

item.title: Asia Pacific accounts for half of all card spending
item.description: New data from Euromonitor International reveals that global consumer reliance on card payments increased from 2014 to 2015, with the Asia Pacific region leading this trend. By 2015, the Asia Pacific region accounted for half of all card spending. This growth is projected to continue, with the region comprising 54% of the estimated US$29.2 trillion global card payment value by 2020. China’s favorable regulations for card and electronic payments have greatly contributed to this surge.

item.description: Source: Euromonitor website. Market research firm Euromonitor International has published a new report on the growing market of older consumers. Though businesses have often overlooked this demographic— individuals aged 60 and above— due to perceptions of low spending, limited income, and resistance to marketing, this group is expanding rapidly. item.title: DED and DIB introduce a credit card with safeguards for consumer rights
item.description: Source: DED. The Dubai Department of Economic Development (DED) and Dubai Islamic Bank (DIB), the UAE’s leading Islamic bank, have introduced the Consumer Card in the UAE. DIB currently serves a vast retail customer base exceeding 1.5 million people through its 90 branches nationwide. This collaborative credit card prioritizes consumer protection and offers savings on everyday transactions. It reflects the DED’s commitment to partnering with the private sector and enhancing the shopping experience in Dubai and the wider UAE.

item.title: The Singapore Expo CNY Fair offers daily discounts of S$380 to the first 888 customers
item.description: Red envelopes containing discounts, called angbaos, can be redeemed for certain products in addition to existing promotions (terms and conditions apply). Items will be offered at up to 88% off. The Singapore Expo CNY Fair will distribute complimentary lucky angbao gift packages, each valued at S$380, to the initial 888 attendees daily from January 10th to 12th. The event will be held at Singapore Expo Hall 6, open from 12 pm to 9 pm each day.
